pull.title: [Wallet] add HD keypath to CKeyMetadata, report over validateaddress
pull.body:
Adds the HD keypath (example: `m/0'/0'/1') to the persisted CKeyMetadata object.

Currently, the used keypath scheme is still static and should be made dynamic/configurable in a different PR.

events.message: [Wallet] add HD keypath to CKeyMetadata, report over validateaddress

events.body: @MarcoFalke: thanks. Added mentioning in the `validateaddress` help.
I think this conflicts with key origin which is for better or worse being used in the wild.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -56,8 +56,10 @@ def run_test (self):
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[2].listunspent()), 0)
 
         # Send 21 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 11)
+        addr = self.nodes[2].getnewaddress()
+        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr, 11)
comments.body: Can you please fix the comment above? You are sending 11 BTC but the comment says 21 BTC.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -56,8 +56,10 @@ def run_test (self):
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[2].listunspent()), 0)
 
         # Send 21 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 11)
+        addr = self.nodes[2].getnewaddress()
+        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr, 11)

@@ -55,9 +55,11 @@ def run_test (self):
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[1].listunspent()), 1)
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[2].listunspent()), 0)
 
-        # Send 21 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 11)
+        # Send 11 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
+        addr = self.nodes[2].getnewaddress()
+        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr, 11)
         self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 10)
+        assert(self.nodes[2].validateaddress(addr)["hdkeypath"] == "m/0'/0'/1'")
comments.body:
Not sure about this one but I feel we could create a fresh rpc-test/hd-wallet.py or wallet-hd.py, as I expect the hd functionality will be extended further.

In the future it would be easier to extend the hd test if it was a separate file and we wouldn't need to fiddle with the already bloated wallet.py

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,9 +55,11 @@ def run_test (self):
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[1].listunspent()), 1)
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[2].listunspent()), 0)
 
-        # Send 21 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 11)
+        # Send 11 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
+        addr = self.nodes[2].getnewaddress()
+        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr, 11)
         self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 10)
+        assert(self.nodes[2].validateaddress(addr)["hdkeypath"] == "m/0'/0'/1'")
comments.body: Yes. As soon as we have an bip32 import function (start a wallet with given xpriv) this makes sense. Without that, it's hard to cover the new hd features in tests. For this little change I guess it would be an overkill to start the a new test-script.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,9 +55,11 @@ def run_test (self):
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[1].listunspent()), 1)
         assert_equal(len(self.nodes[2].listunspent()), 0)
 
-        # Send 21 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 11)
+        # Send 11 BTC from 0 to 2 using sendtoaddress call.
+        addr = self.nodes[2].getnewaddress()
+        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr, 11)
         self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[2].getnewaddress(), 10)
+        assert(self.nodes[2].validateaddress(addr)["hdkeypath"] == "m/0'/0'/1'")
comments.body: I think it is wrong to use `wallet.py` to test HD behavior. Instead, we should set `-usehd=0` for the wallet tests and create a separate file for HD test. Otherwise, the legacy wallet is completely untested.
